thread.title: ASX trades sideways but this company climbed 15.4%
thread.title_full: ASX trades sideways but this company climbed 15.4% | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: ASX trades sideways but this company climbed 15.4%
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)Australian stocks have lost steam with the ASX200 closing nearly unchanged at 5670.1 points a gain of just 0.5 points.

Major miners were mixed with BHP Billiton ( ASX:BHP ) up 0.1% to 27.10 while Fortescue Metals Group (ASX:FMG) fell 2% to 1.72.

Newcrest ( ASX:NCM ) rose 1.4% to 13.20 and Rio Tinto (ASX:RIO) is down 0.6% to 53.01

Market action here… 

Impact Minerals ( ASX:IPT ) climbed 15.4% to 0.03 with more than 5.9 million shares traded.

The company secured funding of up to 7.3 million from Squadron Resources Pty Ltd the private mining investment vehicle of the Minderoo Group.

Mining magnate Andrew Forrest privately-owns Squadron Resources and has previously outlined how Squadron will be used to make investments in the mining sector.

Impact recently discovered Australia’s highest ever platinum grades at the company’s Red Hill prospect.

Red Hill part of the Broken Hill Project includes a 30 metre thick zone at 6 grams per tonne platinum equivalent as well as 5 to 10 metre thick zones at 15g/t platinum equivalent.

White Cliff Minerals ( ASX:WCN ) rose 12.5% to 0.009 with 3 million shares traded Cauldron Energy ( ASX:CXU ) is up 50% to 0.18 Bisan Limited ( ASX:BSN ) gained 25% to 0.005 and Elemental Minerals ( ASX:ELM ) climbed 10% to 0.22.


Blue Chip Stocks

Woodside Petroleum ( ASX:WPL ) up 1.2% to 34.99

National Australia Bank ( ASX:NAB ) up 0.06% to 34.34

Bendigo and Adelaide Bank ( ASX:BEN ) up 0.2% to 12.96
Macquarie Group ( ASX:MQG ) up 0.5% to 83.51
Suncorp ( ASX:SUN ) up 0.1% to 14.17
Telstra ( ASX:TLS ) down 0.6% to 6.42

Retailers

Wesfarmers ( ASX:WES ) up 0.2% to 41.75
Woolworths ( ASX:WOW ) up 1.1% to 28.50
